definitions.definition: A spoken lesson or exposition, usually delivered to a group.
definitions.example: During class today the professor delivered an interesting lecture.

definitions.definition: (by extension) a class that primarily consists of a (weekly or other regularly held) lecture (as in sense 1) [usually at college or university]

definitions.example: I really don't want you to give me a lecture about my bad eating habits.

definitions.definition: To teach (somebody) by giving a speech on a given topic.
definitions.example: The professor lectured to two classes this morning.

definitions.definition: To preach, to berate, to scold.
definitions.example: Emily's father lectured her about the importance of being home before midnight.
